After repeated pleas, a wheelchair was briefly provided, only for staff to ask her to get up and walk immediately after deplaning. She was forced to walk across the runway and board a bus. The lack of empathy and basic decency towards an elderly passenger was humiliating and inhumane. This experience has ensured we will never fly IndiGo again, and we strongly advise others to reconsider if travelling with vulnerable family members.

content:
If there were an award for the most painfully horrible airline app, the IndiGo app would win it hands down. This app has been broken, slow, and unreliable for years, and somehow, it keeps getting worse.

What Doesn’t Work? Everything.
	•	Booking a flight? Good luck! The app crashes or throws random errors midway.
	•	Checking in? Half the time, the boarding pass won’t generate, forcing you to queue at the airport like it’s 1999.
	•	Managing bookings? Want to modify a flight? You’ll either be stuck in an endless loading screen or redirected to an error message with zero explanation.
	•	Payment? Cards get declined for no reason, UPI transactions fail, and sometimes, money gets deducted without confirming the booking.
	•	User Interface? Outdated, clunky, and as intuitive as an airline safety manual written in hieroglyphics.

This Isn’t a New Problem

It’s not like the app was great and suddenly deteriorated. It’s been like this for years! IndiGo, India’s largest airline, still can’t manage to develop an app that functions at even a basic level.

The Worst Part? No Fixes, No Improvement

Despite thousands of complaints, the app never gets better. Updates either break new things or fix nothing. IndiGo clearly doesn’t care about its digital experience, even though millions of passengers rely on it.

Final Verdict: Avoid at All Costs

Use the desktop website (if you dare), or just accept your fate and visit the airport counter. This app is beyond saving, and unless IndiGo invests in proper tech infrastructure, it’s a lost cause.
title: Excrutiatingly horrible app

content:
Today I was travelling by Indigo connecting flight  . My flight was booked from Chandigarh to New Delhi which was scheduled to departure at 13:05 pm . My connecting flight was scheduled at 20:05 from New Delhi to AUH .

I had my PCR done on 24th at 15:35pm and I was confused about the rules and regulations about international travel. I called customer care on 24th asking them about the RT  PCR requirements  . They told me that it will be counted once the report is out and  not from the time of sample taken.

On 25th when I had received results just to clear my doubts  I again called indigo customer care and gave them full details about my sample taken and time of report being out.  My call was taken care by a lady by the name of Akanksha . She was although very polite and I had given feedback as well the way she had handled my call. I had asked her to please tell me if there is any problems in my current report timings and she could tell me that at that very moment so that I can take fresh PCR on 25th as I do not want any problems in my boarding but she said no to worry and go ahead with same report.

But today 26th February when I arrived at almost at 9:10 am at the airport , I was denied flight sighting that my sample taken is at 15:35 while my connecting flight is on 20:05 from Delhi and there was time gap. I informed the airport executives that  I had already cross checked about this from customer care executive yesterday and they told me not to worry and go ahead with same report  and there will be no issues. But the executives at the airport they told me to get a new report so that I could get boarding while not giving any details for further assistance. So I ran away to nearest hospital.
While I was getting the PCR done at nearby Hospital, I was informed by hospital staff that  report will arrive at 12 pm . After knowing which I called customer care again to update them about my whereabouts and chances of missing flight and help me out in that situation. 

The customer care executive was Aakash Dass. I told him the whole scenario  and told him about my whereabouts and chances of missing the flight due the report issue  I asked for his help if he can schedule me in any other immediate flight available today itself so that I can catch my next  flight . He told me there is no flight available today. Then asked him is there any solution as I have to catch the next flight anyhow and I am even ready to go by road.He said he can cancel my that flight and do partial refund of 31 aed. I said to him it’s of no use I asked him if he is sure if there is no flight available . He said there is no other flight available. In the last he asked me if he can start the partial refund then me having no option said yes. 

But to my shock , the passenger next to me was also in same situation , with same connecting flight and in same hospital and he was also on the a call with customer care at same time . But he was being given options for rescheduling  his flight  at 3:15pm.
 
There was only a gap of 2 minute between his call and my call . Upon hearing this I called the customer care back again and requested to speak to Aakash as he has told me incase I need more Assistance he could be forwarded the call to. But the new customer care executive said this is not possible. I asked him why my fellow passenger was given option of having another flight while I was denied. He said this is due to technical glitch. He said he will rebook my flight but I have to pay 31 aed back.I told him to keep the same flight and I will return  refund the money. 
When me and another passenger reached the airport the was entire new shift and they had no clue what is going on with us and they made us wait without telling us what to do next . After some time they just told us to go to ticketing counter again without giving any explanation.

When we went to the ticketing counter there was a lady and we told her what all happened . Then she said she don’t know what’s the issue between customer care and us. I told her this all confusion had happened due to misinformation provided by customer care executives.

I told her at the airport staff or her should automatically reschedule us to the next flight available. But she said she can’t  change our flight and we have to do new booking. Basically we had to buy a new flight ticket  .

This was a really terrible day of my life where I was made to roam around without being me at any fault. None of the staff members except at Delhi airport and only one person at Chandigarh airport were efficient enough to deal with such situation. The all disaster happened because of wrong information provided by customer care executives. They take good enough 15 to 20 minute to check everything and still get back to you with wrong information.
Airport staff/ ticketing staff  is not empathetic enough and not at all interested to sort the problem out. All executives seek help form manager around and not able to sort the problem out and take too 
much time to understand what exactly is going on . 

I was told no flight is available , no seats available but when I boarded the flight which I bought again from hard earned money , I could see so many empty seats. Siting that root cause of this was misinformation provided by you staff the airport staff should have taken initiative to offer  me next flight instead of directing me to buy the new ticket. Seems like no one really cared through what situation a passenger a going on. 
 
I don’t have more words to express how bad experience it was for me and for surly I will not fly Indigo again.
title: Bad service
